intro: Plectronia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed plectronia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are clustered in dense, cylindrical arrangements. Plectronia subsessilis is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
